meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel mild astonishment or shock.
meanings.sent1: The magician surprized the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: I was surprized by the unexpected gift from my friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat surprized the dog by jumping out from behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: The news of the sudden snowstorm surprized everyone in the town.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the fireworks surprized the sleeping baby.

meanings.definition: To come upon or discover suddenly and unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: We surprized a beautiful waterfall while hiking in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She surprized a hidden treasure chest buried in the sand.
meanings.sent3: The detective surprized the culprit hiding in the closet.
meanings.sent4: The sun surprized us as it emerged from behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was surprized by a rare flower blooming in the desert.
